title: Tech Workers Face a New Reality as Talent Wars Turn to Pink Slips
description: The power, perks and demand that many workers at big tech companies enjoyed over the past decade are giving way to angst over layoffs and shrinking net worths.

title: FTX Files for Bankruptcy
description: The beleaguered cryptocurrency platform filed for bankruptcy, a swift demise for a company hailed as a trusted platform just a week ago. Sam Bankman-Fried has resigned as CEO.

title: Koch Teams With Startup to Build Giant Battery Factory
description: Norwegian battery maker Freyr and Koch are accelerating a project in Georgia to tap U.S. government incentives.

title: Elon Musk Made an Unusual Request in Fallout With Top Lieutenant
description: As Tesla’s stock rose rapidly, Mr. Musk focused on whether compensation for employees matched their contributions, and he asked a top deputy to forfeit some of his unvested equity.

title: FTX Customers Wonder Whether They'll Ever See Their Money Again
description: The cryptocurrency exchange FTX, which is scrambling to raise money to cover a shortfall of up to $8 billion, paused customer withdrawals at its international unit this week.

title: The Difficult Search for Dangerous Space Junk
description: Earth’s orbit is filling up with satellites, rocket bodies and debris. The companies hoping to profit from the cleanup job need a better picture of the problem.

title: SoftBank Posts Profit of More Than $21 Billion After Selling Alibaba Stock
description: SoftBank swung back to black for the first time in three quarters with a profit of more than $21 billion, as gains from a sale of some of its stake in Chinese e-commerce company Alibaba offset losses at its Vision Fund investments.

title: TikTok, Struggling With Slowing Digital-Advertising Industry, Lowers Ad-Revenue Outlook
description: The company has cut its target for this year’s ad revenue to $10 billion from at least $12 billion, CEO Shou Zi Chew told staff in recent weeks.

title: Toyota, Sony Set Up Advanced Chip Business in Japan
description: Next-generation chips are aimed to be produced by the late 2020s as Japan lags behind other nations.
